statement:
[**Lebesgue number lemma:**]{} For every open cover $\mathcal{U}$ of a
compact metric space $X$, there exists a real number $\delta > 0$ such
that every open ball in $X$ of radius $\delta$ is contained in some
element of $\mathcal{U}$.

Any number $\delta$ satisfying the property above is called a [*Lebesgue
number*]{} for the covering $\mathcal{U}$ in $X$.
